ui_surfaces.navigation_path: PPS Administrator User > Network Infrastructure Device
PPS Administrator User > Profiler Authentication Server

inputs.name: DHCP Fingerprinting
inputs.help_text: Enable DHCP fingerprinting by configuring switches to forward DHCP packets to PPS.

inputs.name: SNMP/SSH Profiling
inputs.help_text: Enable SNMP/SSH-based profiling by configuring switches in the Network Infrastructure Device page.

inputs.name: Device Fingerprints Package
inputs.help_text: Download the latest device fingerprints package from the support portal.

actions.description: Configures switches to forward DHCP packets to PPS for profiling.
Configures switches for SNMP/SSH-based profiling in the Network Infrastructure Device page.
Ensures the latest device fingerprints package is downloaded and applied.

constraints.description: The minimum supported fingerprints database version for 9.1R9 is 45.
Configuration steps are applicable only to the new User Interface and cannot be accessed through the old UI.

errors.description: The fingerprints database version is below the minimum required version (45).
Configuration steps cannot be performed using the old User Interface.

steps: Step 1: Navigate to PPS Administrator User > Network Infrastructure Device.
Step 2: Enable SNMP/SSH-based profiling by configuring switches.
Step 3: Download the latest device fingerprints package from the support portal.
Step 4: Ensure the fingerprints database version is 45 or above.
